title: Trump calls for US central bank head to quit immediately
summary: – President Trump has called for the chair of the US Federal Reserve to quit immediately, in an escalation of his attacks on Jerome Powell. title: Tesla’s Numbers Are In, and They’re Not Good
summary: – Elon Musk's political turn has weighed heavily on consumer demand, reports Bloomberg. In the second quarter of 2025, Tesla delivered 443,956 vehicles, a 13.5 percent decline from the same period in 2024. Nearly all of those deliveries were for the company's two most popular models: the Model 3 and Model Y. The drop underscores the lasting impact of Elon Musk's political turn, which has alienated parts of its original

title: Tech Talk: NFC is getting an upgrade. But how does NFC work?
summary: – The NFC Forum has announced NFC Release 15, which extends the range of Near Field Communications from 0.5 centimeters to a full 2 centimeters, extending the range by a factor of four. Notably, the range of NFC has been increased from 0.5 centimeters to a full 2 centimeters, extending the range by a factor of four. title: Scientists just simulated the “impossible” — fault-tolerant quantum code cracked at last
summary: – Researchers from Chalmers University of Technology in Sweden, the University of Milan, the University of Granada, and the University of Tokyo have unveiled a method for simulating specific types of error-corrected quantum computations. To develop truly reliable quantum computers, researchers must be able to correct the errors arising in quantum computations, a vital yet extraordinarily difficult task. title: Microsoft Just Fired About 9,000 People While Making Billions
summary: – Microsoft is laying off thousands of employees, even as its profits and stock price hit historic highs. The software giant, which is playing a central role in the generative AI boom, confirmed to Gizmodo on Wednesday that it's undergoing another major round of layoffs. It's estimated the total cuts for July to be around 8,777 jobs, or just under 4 percent of the global workforce. The company last disclosed its global workforce at 228,000

summary: – Nuki is making its debut in the U.S. with the Smart Lock. title: Google Home makes it even easier to share your smart home devices with others
summary: – Google Home has rolled out its Member access feature, and it's now available to everyone. With version 3.33, users can designate household members as either "Admins" with full control or "Members" with limited access. title: Is the world's largest CCTV surveillance camera vendor going to be the next Huawei? Canada bans Hikvision amidst security fears
summary: – Hikvision Canada Inc., one of the world's largest producers of surveillance cameras, has been ordered to cease operations in the country, citing national security concerns. "The government has determined that Hikvision Canada Inc.’s continued operations in the country would be injurious to Canada’s national security," said Industry Minister Mélanie Joly. title: Deafness reversed: Single injection brings hearing back within weeks
summary: – Gene therapy can improve hearing in children and adults with congenital deafness or severe hearing impairment, according to a new study. Researchers at Karolinska Institutet used a synthetic adeno-associated virus (AAV) to deliver a functional version of the OTOF gene to the inner ear via a single injection through a membrane at the base of the cochlea called the round window. title: Taoiseach to attend Expo 25 following talks with Japan PM
summary: – Ireland's participation in Expo 25 has cost more than €16 million over the past three years, with the pavilion itself accounting for nearly €7 million of that total. It comes as the Taoiseach and Japanese Prime Minister held talks in Tokyo to discuss deepening trade links, bilateral relations and cybersecurity. title: Tesla competitor BYD axes Mexico factory plans
summary: – The world's largest electric vehicle maker is halting plans to build a major factory in Mexico due to concerns about US trade policies. On Wednesday, BYD said that the company still plans to expand further into North or South America, but it does not have a timeline for the plan. summary: – The lead prosecutor tasked with finding justice for four University of Idaho students killed in a grisly quadruple stabbing more than two years ago laid out his key evidence Wednesday at a court hearing for Bryan Kohberger, who agreed to plead guilty earlier this week to avoid the death penalty. title: “A national disgrace”: Republicans blast Pentagon’s “unacceptable” Ukrainian weapons freeze

title: Teen social media ban: Answering every question about Australia’s ‘world-first’ plan
summary: – Australia's decision to introduce a teen social media ban has been called a "world-first" by Crikey. The Australian federal parliament passed the Online Safety Amendment (Social Media Minimum Age) Bill in November 2024, which forces social media companies to enforce a minimum age of 16 for having an account on their platforms. title: Luna leads U.S. past Guatemala to Gold Cup final
summary: – The U.S. hung on to beat Guatemala 2-1 to reach the Concacaf Gold Cup final for the 13th time since 2021. Diego Luna scored twice in the first 15 minutes of the match, then scored with his right in the 15th for his third goal in two games.
